fs.fibu2.data.model
Class ReadingPoint

java.lang.Object
  fs.fibu2.data.model.ReadingPoint
All Implemented Interfaces:
EntrySeparator, XMLConfigurable
public class ReadingPoint
extends java.lang.Object
implements EntrySeparator, XMLConfigurable

A reading point is essentially a day of the year at which the user wants to take a bilancial overview of his journal and perhaps reset all bilancial sums. It can for example be used by tables displaying a journal to insert visual components displaying a bilancial overview. A reading point can be active (i.e. all sums should be reset) or passive (only a bilancial overview is taken) and it can be visible or not. Both properties are reflected by boolean fields which can be set. The date associated to a reading point is a day of the year (more precise time information like hours, minutes, etc. will be ignored) and is considered included when it comes to taking a bilancial overview of all entries up to this reading point and excluded when all entries after this point are taken.

Author:
Simon Hampe

ReadingPoint

public ReadingPoint(java.lang.String name,
                    java.util.GregorianCalendar readingDay)
             throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Constructs a reading point.

Parameters:
name - The name of the point. If null, the empty string is used
readingDay - The date associated to the reading. Must not be null
isActive - Whether this reading point should be regarded as active (bilancial sums are reset)
isVisible - Whether this reading point should be displayed or not
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - - If readingDay == null

compareTo

public int compareTo(Entry e)
Returns:
An integer value depending on whether:
- the date of the entry is less or equal (i.e. before or identical) than the date of this entry (-1) or
- the day of the entry is greater (i.e. after) than this reading point's date (1)
Only day/month/year values are considered in the comparison. More precise information is ignored. If entry == null, 0 is returned

isLessOrEqualThanMe

public boolean isLessOrEqualThanMe(Entry e)
Specified by:
isLessOrEqualThanMe in interface EntrySeparator
Returns:
true, if and only if compareTo(Entry) returns 1

public void configure(org.dom4j.Node n)

- name (String)
- readingday (date: dd.MM.yyyy)
